extendedIngredients.name: butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup softened butter, plus additional butter for preparing the baking sheet

extendedIngredients.name: chile paste
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup chipotle chile paste (Find them here.)

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey
salmon fillets
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 (6-oz) wild-caught Alaskan Coho salmon fillets (I buy them here.)

recipes.title: Wild-Caught Coho Salmon with Honey Chipotle Bourbon Butter

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The King Estate Signature Collection Pinot Gris with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 16 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: King Estate Signature Collection Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Light straw with emerald green hue. Aromas of green apple, citrus, honeysuckle, white peach, apricot and floral notes. Flavors of pear, melon, lemon and lime, wet stone, kiwi and honey. The palate has a soft, rich entry, nice texture, good weight and a long, lively crisp finish.

recipes.instructions: Whisk the honey into the bourbon until it dissolves fully, and then set it aside.  In a medium bowl, or in the basin of a standmixer (like this one, beat the garlic, butter, sea salt and chipotle chile paste together until smooth, then, continue beating the seasoned butter while pouring the honeyed bourbon into the butter in a smooth, thin stream until fully incorporated.Heat the oven to 425 F, and spread a thin layer of butter on the baking sheet.Arrange the salmon on the greased baking sheet, and then spoon the Honey Chipotle Bourbon Butter  generously over each filet.  Brush the butter along the whole fillet to evenly coat them.  Bake the salmon for 15 minutes, or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.

steps.step: Whisk the honey into the bourbon until it dissolves fully, and then set it aside.  In a medium bowl, or in the basin of a standmixer (like this one, beat the garlic, butter, sea salt and chipotle chile paste together until smooth, then, continue beating the seasoned butter while pouring the honeyed bourbon into the butter in a smooth, thin stream until fully incorporated.

Heat the oven to 425 F, and spread a thin layer of butter on the baking sheet.Arrange the salmon on the greased baking sheet, and then spoon the Honey Chipotle Bourbon Butter  generously over each filet.
Brush the butter along the whole fillet to evenly coat them.
Bake the salmon for 15 minutes, or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.
